page.title: 07FAUNA & FISH IN MARSKE AREA.
page.content: Hares-fewer since hard winter of 1979. Rabbits-abundant in spite of periods of myxamotosis. Some are living in walls. Badgers-seen occasionally-tracks are noticed. Foxes-build up in numbers and have to be thinned out to safeguard lambs. Grey Squirrels-a steady number. Moles-A heavy population. Reasonable numbers of Shrews, Mice and Voles. Rats-about farm buildings are checked. Bats-among larger trees at night. Stoats & Weasels in roadside verges. Although fish are fewer than in past years, a trout of 2.5 lbs was caught in the Marske Beck this year.
